summary: This FBI 302 form documents an interview conducted on August 10, 2019, with a BOP nurse/medic regarding the response to the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on July 23, 2019. The nurse describes arriving at Epstein's cell, finding him unresponsive with a ligature around his neck, and the subsequent unsuccessful resuscitation efforts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the medical emergency and death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The nurse found him unresponsive with a ligature around his neck.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center with a ligature around his neck. BOP guards and medical staff responded, performed CPR, and attempted to use an AED, but he was pronounced dead.

events.title: FBI Interview with BOP Nurse
events.description: An FBI investigator interviewed a BOP nurse/medic regarding the response to Epstein's death. The interview took place on the 9th floor outside the 'L' tier at the MCC.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
keyFacts: The BOP nurse received a call via radio alarm at 0633 hours on the day of the incident and arrived at Epstein's cell at 0635 hours.
Upon arrival, the nurse observed BOP guards inside the cell administering CPR to Epstein.
The nurse checked Epstein for vitals and detected no pulse and no signs of life.
An Automated External Defibrillator (AED) was used twice on Epstein, but it advised 'no shock' both times.
The nurse stated that when he entered the cell, Epstein was lying parallel to the bunk bed with a ligature still around his neck.
